news.title: Data breach at credit check giant 700Credit affects at least 5.6 million
news.summary: 700Credit, a company that runs credit checks and identity verification services for auto dealerships across the U.S., had a data breach that allowed a hacker to steal names, addresses, dates of birth, and Social Security numbers.

news.title: Trump’s AI executive order promises ‘one rulebook’ — startups may get legal limbo instead
news.summary: Trump signed an AI executive order targeting state laws and promising one national rulebook. Critics warn it could trigger court battles and prolong uncertainty for startups while Congress debates federal rules.

news.title: Google Translate now lets you hear real-time translations in your headphones
news.summary: The real-time headphone translations experience keeps each speaker’s tone, emphasis, and cadence intact, so it’s easier to follow the conversation and tell who’s saying what.

news.title: Retro, a photo-sharing app for friends, lets you ‘time-travel’ through your camera roll
news.summary: Retro's new feature, Rewind, lets you look back at your photo memories and scroll through them with a dial.

news.title: Home Depot exposed access to internal systems for a year, says researcher
news.summary: A security researcher tried to alert Home Depot to the security lapse exposing its back-end GitHub source code repos and other internal cloud systems, but was ignored.

news.title: Google Translate brings real-time speech translations to any headphones
news.summary: Google Translate's latest update brings live speech translations, originally available only on the Pixel Buds, to any headphones you want, with support for over 70 languages. news.title: This Group Pays Bounties to Repair Broken Devices—Even If the Fix Breaks the Law
news.summary: Fulu sets repair bounties on consumer products that employ sneaky features that limit user control. Just this week, it awarded more than $10,000 to the person who hacked the Molekule air purifier.
